intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaved cow-wheat, is a rare and distinctive plant species characterized by its unique morphological features. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is notable for its rounded, heart-shaped leaves that give it a distinct appearance compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant.
